subtopics.name: Abstraction and Categorization
subtopics.description: This subtopic focuses on the process of distilling sensory and perceptual inputs into abstract concepts and categories. It is the mechanism by which raw data from the perceptual domain is organized into meaningful structures, forming the building blocks of higher-order thinking and understanding.

subtopics.name: Pattern Recognition
subtopics.description: This subtopic explores the identification of recurring structures, relationships, and regularities within data. It is through pattern recognition that humans discern order and coherence, enabling the transformation of disparate observations into unified concepts.

subtopics.name: Symbolism and Representation
subtopics.description: This subtopic examines the use of symbols, language, and other representational systems to encode and communicate abstract ideas. It highlights the role of shared representations in structuring knowledge and facilitating collective understanding.

subtopics.name: Framework Construction
subtopics.description: This subtopic addresses the creation of conceptual frameworks and models that organize and interrelate abstract ideas. These frameworks provide the scaffolding for deeper analysis and the integration of diverse knowledge domains.

subtopics.name: Meaning and Interpretation
subtopics.description: This subtopic delves into the assignment of meaning to concepts and the interpretative processes that shape understanding. It emphasizes the subjective and contextual nature of conceptual knowledge, linking it to relational and reflective domains.
